questions.question: In digital circuit design, what does RTL primarily stand for?
options: Register Transfer Level
Real-Time Logic
Resource Task Layout
Routine Test Language
Resistive Transistor Logic

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Static Timing Analysis (STA) in the digital IC design flow?
options: To simulate the circuit's behavior with specific test vectors.
To verify the logical correctness of the design by formal methods.
To identify and verify all possible timing paths meet their setup and hold constraints without dynamic simulation.
To extract parasitic resistances and capacitances from the layout.
To generate test patterns for manufacturing defect detection.

questions.question: Amdahl's Law in computer architecture primarily describes which of the following?
options: The maximum speed-up of a program when adding more processors, given a sequential portion.
The relationship between cache hit rate and overall memory access time.
The optimal number of pipeline stages for a given processor frequency.
The power consumption reduction achievable through dynamic voltage scaling.
The trade-off between instruction set complexity and compiler efficiency.

questions.question: In advanced semiconductor manufacturing, what is the primary goal of employing Design for Manufacturability (DFM) techniques?
options: To minimize the overall area of the integrated circuit.
To reduce the power consumption of the chip during operation.
To improve the functional performance of the circuit at high frequencies.
To enhance the yield and reliability of the silicon chips by making designs less sensitive to manufacturing variations.
To simplify the logic synthesis process and reduce design time.

questions.question: In the context of computer architecture and cache memory, what does the 'principle of locality' primarily refer to?
options: The physical proximity of memory modules to the CPU on the motherboard.
The tendency of a program to access data and instructions that are spatially or temporally close to recently accessed ones.
The ability of a cache to store data locally within each processor core.
The restriction that a program can only access memory within its assigned address space.
The process by which memory addresses are translated from virtual to physical.
